intro: Harbouria, commonly known as the "screw pine," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Pandanaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plants typically have a short, woody stem with a crown of leaves emerging from the top. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Pacific and Indian Oceans. Harbouria species are often used in traditional medicine and horticulture due to their ornamental value and adaptability.
